comments.body: I'm not really sure what this `agnhost` means but question is - is this name still relevant after adding so many other subcommands?

Eh, less so. So, the name ``agnhost`` comes from "agnhost host", which basically means that it'll work the same on any OS. But it is still true, the image still contains the common Linux utilities on both Linux and Windows, including /bin/sh, nc, etc., and 3 of the current subcommands still accomplish the original goal. Adding the other subcommands doesn't necessarely go against its goal.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +18,22 @@## Usage

The `agnhost` binary has several subcommands which are can be used to test different
Kubernetes features; their behaviour and output is not affected by the underlying OS.
